title: Dannii Minogue reveals the moment she feared her showbiz career was OVER
text:
Dannii Minogue has been working in the entertainment industry for 41 years.

And as the music and television star celebrates her 48th birthday this week, she has reflected on the moment she feared her showbiz career was over.

Speaking to Stellar magazine on Sunday, Dannii admitted that when she left Young Talent Time in 1988, at just 16, she felt she was now too old to succeed.

'I thought, 'That's it, I'm done'': Dannii Minogue (pictured) has reflected on the moment she feared her showbiz career was over

'Globally, in film and TV and acting, there's so many women of different ages being featured now. There's not that fear of an expiry date,' began Dannii.

'I definitely had that thought at age 16 when I left Young Talent Time. I thought, 'That's it, I'm done.' I'd have to get a normal job.'

Dannii continued: 'You keep working, wondering how long it will go on for, but I'm feeling more positive about the acceptance of women of all ages.'

Fears! Speaking to Stellar on Sunday, Dannii admitted that when she left Young Talent Time in 1988, at just 16, she felt she was now too old to succeed. Pictured on YTT in 1988

'[I thought] I'd have to get a normal job': Dannii said she felt women in the industry had an 'expiry date' back then, and that she may have already of reached hers as a teenager

Australian star Dannii first found fame at aged 7, appearing on soap operas such as Skyways and The Sullivans.

Following in sister Kyle Minogue's footsteps, she signed a recording contract with Australian-based Mushroom Records in January 1989.

Alongside her career as a pop star and media personality, Dannii has also become regular judge on TV talent shows all around the world.

'You keep working, wondering how long it will go on for, but I'm feeling more positive about the acceptance of women of all ages,' Dannii continued. Pictured: Dannii performing in 1991

Over the years, she has starred on: The X Factor UK, The X Factor Australia, Australia's Got Talent, Britain & Ireland's Next Top Model and many more.

Dannii is currently appearing on The Masked Singer Australia, which has become a surprise ratings hit and captivated the country.

She judges alongside Lindsay Lohan, Jackie 'O' Henderson and Dave Hughes.

The Masked Singer Australia finale airs Monday at 7.30pm on Channel 10
description: Dannii Minogue has been working in the entertainment industry for 41 years.
authors: Joshua Fox For Daily Mail Australia
